Issues.Title: Winforms availability in Visual Studio Tools for Office (VSTO)
Issues.Body:
Please make the new Winforms available for Visual Studio Tools for Office. VSTO add-ins using C# and Winforms is a very powerful tool for extending Office, which is currently available only using legacy NET. 

For more details and use cases please see:
https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/idea/757925/please-port-visual-studio-tools-for-office-vsto-to.html?childToView=1201801
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Winforms availability in Visual Studio Tools for Office (VSTO)" (#4061)

Issues.Title: Fix issue with announcing ExpandedCollapsedState for ComboBox in Property grid #1987
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #1987

## Proposed changes

- removed RaiseAutomationEvent and RaiseAutomationPropertyChangedEvent and replaced them on a RaiseAutomationNotification

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact
Due to two competing requests to the Narrator in half of the cases the narrator announces the selected option, and in the other half the ExpandedCollapsedState of the control:
![1987-issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/95203022-d1e32c80-07ea-11eb-8424-67fd208aaea9.gif)
After fixing, the focus always remains on the selected item and Narrator announces selected option and ExpandedCollapsedState of control:
![1987-fixed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/95203058-e58e9300-07ea-11eb-952a-d3515fef4e12.gif)




## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19041.388]
- .Net SDK 5.0.100-rc.1.20420.14

Issues.Title: Correct TextBox.PlaceholderText font transparency
Issues.Body:
## Proposed changes

Whenever the `PlaceHolderText` property was set on a disabled textbox the placeholder text would be drawn with an opaque background.
Correct the text background transparency.

Fixes #3642.
Closes https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/4008 as obsolete

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

Copied from https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/4008

### After

![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/439370/94248991-89d92580-ff1f-11ea-87f7-4169de3ad7e7.png)

- tests

Issues.Title: Localization of WinForms templates
Issues.Body:
# Localize Templates


## Customer Impact

We need the template title and description localized for the WinForms Project templates and with the correct wording for .NET Framework.

## Regression? 

No

## Risk

- Low - we're just changing the template files.


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

* Setup a German environment both a German Windows and German Visual Studio.
* Compiled WinForms repo with -pack option.
* Replaced the current WinForms templates with the newly generated package:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9663150/95264699-a78e7080-07e4-11eb-8961-62915e8b0dfb.png)

* Tested creating a new project at the command line to ensure English original strings are correct:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9663150/95272968-a6fed580-07f6-11eb-8a96-e891e535fa1a.png)

* Tested creating a new new project in VS to ensure the localized template strings are picked:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9663150/95272887-6f902900-07f6-11eb-9773-1b5bc049ac0c.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Localization of WinForms templates" (#4056)

Issues.Title: OutOfMemoryException in .NET 5, thrown from Graphics.FromHdcInternal
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
5.0.0-rc.1.20451.14 X64

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No. Additionally, this bug does NOT occur in .NET Core 3.1.

**Problem description:**

I'm getting an OutOfMemoryException at least 5-6 times per day in an application when running under .NET 5 RC. The same application (same apart from the .runtimeconfig.json) has been running under .NET 3.1 for months, and by tens of thousands of users without the error occurring.

The exception is always thrown from System.Drawing.Graphics.FromHdcInternal(IntPtr). The exact stack trace varies (because FromHdcInternal is called from a number of places). Here's an example:

  at System.Drawing.Graphics.FromHdcInternal(IntPtr hdc)
  at System.Drawing.Font.GetHeight()
  at System.Drawing.Font.get_Height()

Here's another example:

-System.Drawing.Graphics.FromHdcInternal(IntPtr hdc)
-System.Windows.Forms.DrawingEventArgs.GetOrCreateGraphicsInternal(System.Action`1[System.Drawing.Graphics]) offset: 0x65
-System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs.get_Graphics()

I've checked the process statistics when this error occurs and nothing is out of the ordinary. Here's a typical sample:
  Private working set: 215MB
  Handles: 1247
  User objects: 488
  GDI objects: 288

I've also checked my code base to ensure that there are no cases of GDI objects such as Brushes not being disposed. I've also checked with the individual stack traces that nothing is being disposed that shouldn't (e.g., that the Font objects is not being disposed before calling the .Height property).

This error occurs randomly after the program has been running for a while, so I can not provide a series of steps to reproduce it. As I understand, the OutOfMemoryException doesn't actually indicate an out-of-memory condition. Could the error reporting be upgraded to generate a more meaningful message?

As I mentioned, this application is in use by tens of thousands of people under .NET 3.1. I won't be able to upgrade to .NET 5 if the issue remains at RTM.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "OutOfMemoryException in .NET 5, thrown from Graphics.FromHdcInternal" (#4053)

Issues.Title: Fixing issue with null BoundingRectangle property of ToolStripStatusLabel
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #3884


## Proposed changes
- updated implementation for IsOffscreen property. Now, in addition to the Placement of the ListViewItem, it also respects its size. In this way Inspector or Accessibility Insights see that element is not displayed and don't try to get its BoundingRectangle
- added unit tests;

## Customer Impact
Accessibility Insight show exception for Form containing a ToolStripStatusLabel with a zero size:
![92879854-fd6b3500-f43f-11ea-8954-b87da53296d2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/94912027-b5c05200-04af-11eb-938b-9492fee6058d.png)
After fixing, Accessibility Insight doesn't show errors:
![3884-fixed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/94912134-de484c00-04af-11eb-8103-b2a3cf101d2f.jpg)

Issues.Title: The Inspector hangs when the user creates a circular dependency for the ListViewGroup and ListViewItem
Issues.Body:
.NET Core Version:
.NET SDK 5.0.100-rc.1.20420.14

Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?:
No

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create application with list view.
2. Create ListViewGroup
3. Create ListViewItem linked to ListViewGroup
4. Add ListViewItem to ListViewGroup
5. Add ListViewGroup to ListView
6. Add ListViewItem to ListView
7. Run application.
8. Run Inspector.
9. Try to get data about ListViewItem in Inspector.
10. Or just user attached [WindowsFormsApp3.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5310765/WindowsFormsApp3.zip)


**Expected behavior:**
Data about selected ListViewItem should be displayed.

**Actual behavior:**
Inspector hangs or return that the ListViewGroup contains a huge number of ListViewItems
![ListViewAndInspector](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/94789698-edf76000-03dd-11eb-9c85-348bad3717f3.jpg)

Issues.Title: ListView in virtual mode doesn't throw exception when user tries to add ListViewGroup
Issues.Body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
ListView in virtual mode does not support ListViewGroup. If user tries to add ListViewGroup then he will see an exception. But if handle for ListView is not created then user has ability to add group to ListView. As result user has workaround for adding of group ListView in virtual mode, although ListViewGroups  are not supported by ListView

**Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered**
I suggest to throw exception regardless of whether the ListView has handle or not. Thus, the user will not be able to add a ListViewGroup to ListView in virtual mode

**Will this feature affect UI controls?**
It impacts on adding of ListViewGroups to ListView. But the current behavior of the ListView seems to be incorrect
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ListView in virtual mode doesn't throw exception when user tries to add ListViewGroup" (#4044)

Issues.Title: ListView is in virtual mode throws IOE when user disables checkboxes
Issues.Body:
- .NET Core Version:
.NET SDK 5.0.100-rc.1.20420.14

- Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?:
Yes

**Minimal repro:**

1. Create application with ListView in virtual mode
2. Enable checkboxes
3. Disable checkboxes
4. Or use attached [WindowsFormsApp3.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5310459/WindowsFormsApp3.zip)

![ListView - checkboxes](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/94779836-360f8600-03d0-11eb-87d7-654cf082fd46.gif)
**StackTrace:**
```
   at System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.get_Count()
   at System.Windows.Forms.ListView.set_CheckBoxes(Boolean value)
   at WindowsFormsApp3.Form1.Button1_Click(Object sender, EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnClick(EventArgs e)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Button.OnClick(EventArgs e)
```

**Expected behavior:**
Checkboxes should be disabled without exceptions

**Actual behavior:**
'Cannot access the checked items collection when the ListView is in virtual mode.' exception is displayed
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ListView is in virtual mode throws IOE when user disables checkboxes" (#4042)

Issues.Title: Fixing issue that Narrator cannot focus on ListView second time
Issues.Body:
Fixes #4030


## Proposed changes

- added calling of "RaiseAutomationEvent" method to "OnGotFocus" method for ListViewItem that had focus. This call returns the Narrator focus (blue rectangle) back to the element;
- added unit tests

## Customer Impact
Narrator focus doesn't switches between ListView when user presses Tab button:
![4030-broken](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/94689418-84247b00-0337-11eb-9744-c4583f9a2264.gif)
After fixing, Narrator focus works correctly:
![4030-fixed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/94689509-a0281c80-0337-11eb-95aa-6ab9685ca603.gif)


## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually
-  Unit tests

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->
- Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19041.388]
- .NET Core 5.0.100-rc.1.20420.14

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Keyboard cannot check/uncheck listView items when enabling listView checkBox property in Virtual Mode
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.Net SDK 5.0.100-rc.2.20477.2

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
Yes

**Minimal repro:**
1. Open the attached ListViewInVirtualMode.zip application in VS, then build and run it.
[ListViewInVirtualMode.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5303187/ListViewInVirtualMode.zip)
2. Focus on ListView item, press Space to check/uncheck it in its checkBox

**Actual behavior:**
Keyboard cannot check/uncheck listView items' checkBox by pressing "Space" in ListView virtual mode, and for mouse, need double-click to check/uncheck, not single-click.
![ListViewVirtualModeIssue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94645595-cf7e5f80-031e-11eb-8a94-eed6ba558aae.gif)

**Expected behavior:**
Keyboard can check/uncheck listView items' checkBox by pressing "Space" in ListView virtual mode, like the result in default mode
![ListViewDefaultMode](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94645601-d2795000-031e-11eb-8679-ac2f9316cd4d.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Keyboard cannot check/uncheck listView items when enabling listView checkBox property in Virtual Mode" (#4033)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] In Inspect, the listView items texts ControlType, LocalizedControlType, LegacyIAccessible.Role properties are not correct when listView LabelEdit is true
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
.Net SDK 5.0.100-rc.2.20477.2

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
No

* More Info
This is a regression issue, cannot repro in .Net Core 3.1

**Minimal repro:**
1. Open the attached WinFormsApp9.zip application in VS, then build and run it.
[WinFormsApp9.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/5302987/WinFormsApp9.zip)
2. Launch Inspect to focus on ListView item text in edit state

**Actual behavior:**
In Inspect, the listView items texts ControlType, LocalizedControlType, LegacyIAccessible.Role properties are not correct when listView LabelEdit is true
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94639828-af936f80-030f-11eb-8b1c-2e9095b119fc.png)

**Expected behavior:**
In Inspect, the listView items texts ControlType, LocalizedControlType, LegacyIAccessible.Role properties are correct when listView LabelEdit is true
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/94639852-c20da900-030f-11eb-805c-56024a8d72a1.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] In Inspect, the listView items texts ControlType, LocalizedControlType, LegacyIAccessible.Role properties are not correct when listView LabelEdit is true" (#4032)
